newsitem.title: JAPAN: Meiji Mutual Life says may invest in foreign bonds.
newsitem.headline: Meiji Mutual Life says may invest in foreign bonds.

text.p: Kenjiro Hata, president of Meiji Mutual Life Insurance Co, said on Friday that the insurer may boost its foreign bond investments if there are no sharp movements in foreign exchange rates.

Although the dollar/yen rate is unlikely to swing sharply in response to the changing pattern of Japan's trade surplus, the dollar could spike briefly to the higher end of the 120-130 yen range, he told a news conference.
The dollar rose as high as 127.16 yen recently.
The interest rate gap between Japan and the United States is poised to widen, he added.
Hata also said that his company wanted to give serious consideration to capital investment in Nippon Credit Bank Ltd.

Hata, who is also chairman of Japan's Life Insurance Association, told the news conference that there is a possibility that Japan's interest rates will rise later this year due to a recovery in the Japanese economy.
